15 Reasons OnlyFans is Better Than Sugar Daddy-Baby Dating

15 Reasons OnlyFans is Better Than Sugar Daddy-Baby Dating

Ever heard the expression, "out with the old and in with the new?". This isn't just another expression but has been the natural order of things.

Promoting Your OnlyFans on YouTube: 9 Proven Ways

Estimated Reading Time: 3 min 12 sec

Did you know that 53.9% of YouTube’s audience comprises of men? Coincidentally, OnlyFans hosts more male subscribers and female creators. Not to forget, YouTube has more than 2.5 billion users. This data is calling to you as an OnlyFans model, urging you not to skip the chance to rake in more subs from YouTube to your OnlyFans business. But, have you read YouTube’s external links policy, and sexual and nudity content policy?

If you go through the two policies, you will realize that YouTube is against sharing and selling NSFW “not safe for work” content on their platform and sites that promote the distribution and selling of NSFW content. Therefore, even if you create SFW “safe for work” content on OnlyFans, you might have a hard time crossing your subs over from YouTube. But, not to worry, this article has a concrete solution to this issue and will help you effectively promote your OnlyFans on YouTube. 

The YouTube community has stringent rules against sharing nudity and sexual content within their platform. Posting any pornographic or sexually gratifying content may lead to YouTube taking down your content or permanently banning your account. Videos filled with fetish content may be age restricted or taken down. Moreover, linking to a website that breaks these rules is not allowed. 

YouTube banned some accounts of OnlyFans creators without warning simply because they had embedded their OnlyFans referral link within their video description section. Some creators lost their YouTube accounts because they posted nudity content. Despite this, if you were to search YouTube using keywords such as “Sex Videos,” you will realize that YouTube hosts sexually explicit content that has not been taken down. This confusion begs the question: as an OnlyFans model, how do you promote your OnlyFans on YouTube without getting into logger heads with YouTube’s content restrictions and external linking policies?

Make an appointment now

 

1. Let Your YouTube Profile do the Promoting 

Before a prospective subscriber decides to click on that subscribe and notification button, they are likely to first check out your profile. Your profile helps the prospective subscriber decide whether to subscribe and keep tabs on your upcoming content or not based on the information you provide on your profile. This information includes the videos you have posted, the channels you own, playlists, the about section and more. 

  • Describing your OnlyFans on Youtube

Bear in mind that your profile acts as a summary of what your YouTube channel is all about with the most impactful information being within the about section. Within the about section, you can provide a description of your channel, location details, and link to other websites. 

To write an effective description of your channel, you must first consider your target audience with reference to the content you post on OnlyFans. Create persona descriptions for your target audience to ensure the about section promotes your content to the right people on the fly. 

Persona descriptions contain details including the demographics and psychographics of your target audience. The demographics analysis describes the gender, age, income, and more about your prospective subscriber. A psychographics analysis looks into the opinions, personality outlook, lifestyle choices, and more about your target subscriber. You should research more to create a detailed persona description. 

The aim of creating a persona description is to help you understand your prospective subscriber and come up with the correct words to use within your description. Using words that appeal to your target audience makes them feel understood; therefore, giving your channel a chance by subscribing. 

After creating a persona description and recording a list of the words you can use to communicate to your target audience, you should now be able to write a worthy description. The description should outline the type of content you create, your objectives, and have a clear call to action. 

If your niche covers NSFW content, do not mention it within your profile; rather, use suggestive words that signal your target audience that you have an NSFW-oriented OnlyFans channel. For example, you can use a phrase such as, “Top 1%, can’t wait to see you on the other side. Let’s chat. Links in my profile.” You can also use suggestive emojis. Avoid mentioning the word OnlyFans in your description. 

Your objectives should be genuine with regard to the type of content you post on OnlyFans and YouTube. Remember, despite creating SFW or NSFW content, you should not mention that you have an OnlyFans account within your descriptions. The objectives should inform the prospective subscriber what they stand to benefit once they subscribe to your content. 

Your call to action should use compelling language with action words that clearly inform the potential subscriber what they are signing in for and what to do next. Keep in mind that the aim of the call to action is to help the future subscriber make a quick decision, so keep it simple, concise, and clear. But, do not sacrifice clarity for briefness. 

  • Linking your OnlyFans on Youtube

Avoid including a direct link to your OnlyFans account. As you can remember, YouTube is not in good terms with creators who link out to websites that undermine their community rules. Despite the very many personal comments you might read out of their information, you can just use a direct link to OnlyFans, do not do it; instead, use a third-party linking platform to mask your OnlyFans link. 

Some of the third-party link generating platforms you can use include Link in Bio, Bitly, and Tiny URL. Avoid using Linktree because it is popular among OnlyFans creators so being flagged is quite easy. There are more platforms out there you can use to mask your OnlyFans links including the referral link. Using the least known platform is the best option. 

Additionally, you should ensure that your username, display name, profile and cover photo send a clear message to your potential subscriber informing them of what your YouTube channel is all about. All these aspects of your profile are usually in the view of your prospective subscriber while they go through the about section. Therefore, you cannot afford to not optimize them.  

You should have a memorable username and display name. A name that rhymes with your content type. For example, if you are creating fitness content you can have “fitgeek24” as your name. If you cannot figure out a name that your future subscriber can easily remember, use name generators. A name generator requires you to provide precise details such as your niche and target audience for it to come up with an effective name you can use. 

If you are an NSFW content creator, avoid using popular sex implying characters such as “xxx” within your username or display name. You can use a name that describes what the subscriber stands to benefit. For example, if you create NSFW content depicting erotic massages, but less revealing massages to avoid your account being banned, you can use the username, “erotikmas101.”

  • Profile Picture and Cover Photo Selection 

When selecting a profile and cover photo to upload to YouTube, use quality photos and incorporate design to lure subscribers. Upload a clear photo of you within the profile photo section to boost authenticity. If you create anonymous content on OnlyFans, you can upload a masked photo of you. 

Since the display space of your profile picture is huge, you can incorporate design skills to come up with a photo that depicts the type of content you post. For example, you can have a grid view of your previous content or a call-to-action message. The aim is to ensure your target audience becomes thrilled to know they have landed on the right channel. If you can afford it, hire an expert graphics designer to help you brainstorm on various ways you can use to capture the attention of your audience as soon as they set eyes on your profile picture. 

Summarily, you must build a well-presented profile with the aim of directly leading your potential subscriber to your OnlyFans page through external linking or to convince the prospective subscriber to subscribe to your channel so that you can later convert the subscriber to a paying fan.

You hook and keep the prospective subscriber’s attention through your detailed description, a strategically selected username and display name, and eye catchy profile and cover photos. All these aspects of profile creation combined with a well-thought-out call to action work together to convince your prospective subscriber to click on the external links within your profile. 

If the potential subscribers do not click on your link leading to your OnlyFans page but decide to subscribe to your channel, you have the chance to convert them to a fan by nurturing them from being leads to paying OnlyFans subscribers. 

2. Search Engine Optimize Your Content 

Other than creating valuable and quality YouTube content and avoiding various post mistakes, you should optimize your content so that your potential subscribers can find you easily on Youtube. YouTube is the second largest search engine used by numerous people seeking to solve various problems. They find their desired content by typing in different keywords within YouTube’s search area. Then, YouTube’s algorithm provides them with an array of videos they can select from and view. That is why you have to undertake keyword research before creating content. 

A keyword research process requires you to first decide the topic you would love to discuss. If you lack a topic of discussion, you must research to determine various questions asked by random users on the internet pointing in the direction of your niche. Once you have a precise topic, you should research to find the correct answers or discussion points you can use to elaborate your topic. By analyzing the discussion points and your topic of discussion, then can you determine the keywords to target. 

There are two types of keywords: short tail and long tail keywords. Short tail keywords are made of less than 3 words while long tail keywords have more than 3 words. Short tail keywords attract greater but less converting traffic while long tail keywords attract low but highly converting traffic. That is why you have to combine both of them to find a better balance of the amount of traffic you receive and the conversion rates.

For example, if you create fitness content on YouTube, a keyword such as “weight-loss” would be a short tail one, while one such as “Weight-loss by women suffering from stress eating” would be a long tail keyword. From this example, you can observe that the short tail keyword lacks a specific target audience while the long tail keyword has a specific target audience. 

Once you have made up your mind on the topic of discussion and collected enough discussion points, it becomes easier for you to outline the keywords you would love your content to be found for. Using the discussion points and the keywords list, you can then write highly effective and converting scripts. You should also include precise keywords within your captions and video descriptions. 

You can also leave a pinned comment on your video with precise keywords to boost the chances of your content being found. Take advantage of the capability to pin your comment on any video to include a message for your prospective subscribers with a clear call to action. You can also include a masked link directing those interested to your OnlyFans page. 

To increase the chances of your content ranking first for the keywords you are targeting, you should transcribe your videos and upload the file to YouTube. The transcribed text serves as captions or subtitles increasing the accessibility of your content. You can also include hashtags to improve the chances of your videos being found. 

Additionally, you should include catchy thumbnails on your videos. Thumbnails serve as the preview of what you have discussed within your videos. Once you have a great thumbnail to include within your videos, create a link card to direct your viewers to your OnlyFans pages. 

3. Create YouTube Shorts Content 

YouTube shorts is YouTube’s TikTok version allowing you to post vertical-oriented content with a duration not more than one minute. YouTube shorts has a daily viewership of more than 7 billion users due to it making it effortless to consume content by randomly scrolling through videos of various niches. 

You should use YouTube shorts to drive more traffic to your channel videos with external links to your OnlyFans page. YouTube has an inbuilt feature that allows you to cut your long-form videos into short snippets so that you can share them on YouTube shorts. Use the feature to create short videos featuring the best parts of your selected video. Upload the video to YouTube Shorts as a trailer of your video driving traffic to it. 

You can also create raw short videos directly on YouTube shorts using the YouTube Short’s camera. You have the option to include animated text, music, and more persuading aspects to your video. To promote your OnlyFans page, you should include a masked link to direct traffic to your page. 

Going viral on YouTube Shorts is easy, but you must produce valuable and quality content for your audience. Always include a hook within your introduction to capture and keep the attention of your target subscriber else they may scroll through. Your hook should be within the first 1-5 seconds, else the viewer might get bored and scroll to another video because doing so is much easier. 

Despite YouTube Shorts allowing you to create videos of about one minute, you should create videos whose duration is less than 40 seconds. Make it quick by having a catchy intro, a quick message, and a call to action. The call to action should be brief , prompting the viewer to act first. The aim of the call to action should be to get the viewer to click a link to your long form videos or your OnlyFans page. 

Luckily, YouTube allows you to have a channel hosting YouTube shorts content only. Hence, if you are worried about experimenting with YouTube shorts within your main channel, you can create a new channel where you post short videos only. This technique allows you to monitor your audience’s response to your short videos as you consider whether posting the short videos on your main channel would favor your YouTube channel and OnlyFans business. 

Make an appointment now

 

4. Involve Social Media Influencers 

Social media influencers are accomplished content creators, athletes, musicians, and more, who have garnered several followers who believe in what the influencer says. Paying an influencer to promote your YouTube channel to their audience can lead to a quick and tremendous growth of your channel. 

Getting access to influencers with a huge following can be hard and expensive but the effort and cost of working to get their attention is worth it. They usually have a following of royal followers who have been keeping tabs on their content for a long time. Therefore, you should aim to pay one that creates content in line with your niche or who values what your content presents. 

If you do not find a suitable influencer, you can select one that has a huge following and have them create content for your channel. You can get them up to speed quickly using a script and instruct them on what to do. Once the content is ready, post it and request the influencer to notify his or her followers to head over to your channel and watch the content. 

Additionally, if you are working with an influencer that has a YouTube channel, you can seal a deal with him or her to link to your YouTube channel. The agreement can be time limited or based on the number of videos on which he or she embeds a link to your channel. 

When working with influencers, do not force them to fake their review of your YouTube channel. Allow them to express themselves and truthfully say what they think about your channel to help their fans make a satisfactory decision. Doing this benefits the influencer and you because the influencer gets to keep his or her fans while your channel receives genuine traffic. 

5. Incentivize Other YouTube Creators to Work with You 

Did you know that working with fellow YouTube creators is four times effective than working with generic influencers. To share in this merit, you must partner with other YouTube creators that create content within the same niche as yours. 

To capture the attention of fellow creators, you must have an incentive. Very few YouTube creators will be willing to work with a stranger without considering the benefits from the deal. Moreover, some creators might have to first consider whether your channel is worth vouching for. 

When you have the chance to network with fellow creators, do so. You can meet fellow creators at summits or any organized group meetings. You can also network with fellow YouTube creators by sending them cold emails. Do not limit your networking to established creators only, get in touch with the underdogs too. 

Before you start contacting your connected list, ensure your YouTube profile sends a strong message regarding what your content is all about and you have a considerable amount of content and engagement in terms of views, likes, and comments. By considering the outlook of your profile and statistics, you can make an informed decision when selecting the YouTube creator to collaborate with. 

After selecting who to send a collaboration proposal to, decide on the incentive to accompany the proposal with. Some of the incentives you can implement include paying the YouTube creator, giving the creator’s channel a shout out on your channel, and more. The incentive should be irresistible to enable your channel to receive more traffic which you can eventually convert to paying fans by directing the new subscribers to your OnlyFans page. 

6. Run Effective Ad Campaigns 

YouTube allows you to run different types of ads including display ads, overlay ads, sponsored cards ads, bumper instream ads, and trueview ads. These ads are placed on different sections of the YouTube page when your prospective subscriber is watching your content, but, despite the type of ad, the main aim of running ads is to expose your channel to a targeted audience based on your persona descriptions. 

YouTube ads are paid for but the cost is not that expensive. You can start with a $10 budget experimenting with various persona descriptions. You can opt to use one or more types of ads availed to you by YouTube on the same budget. 

You have the option to create ads that lead your potential subscribers to your OnlyFans page if you do create SFW content. On the other hand, you can create ads directing your potential subscribers to your channel; once they subscribe to your channel, you can later convert them to paying fans. 

If you are an NSFW OnlyFans creator, do not create NSFW-oriented ads on YouTube. YouTube ads are not suited for the promotion of sexually explicit content. You can opt for a subtle ad that is less revealing, but the chances of YouTube not taking the ad down are few. 

7. Promote Your Brand Through YouTube Merch Shelf 

If you create SFW content on OnlyFans, this is not a feature you can afford to skip. If you are an NSFW content creator, you should use this feature carefully to avoid getting your account flagged. YouTube allows you to sell your branded merchandise using their merch shelf feature that allows you to own a store where you sell your products directly on YouTube. 

To promote your OnlyFans through this feature, you should ensure that the products you sell are branded with your logo and various messages reminding the buyers of your channel. Every subscriber who purchases your product would help you promote your channel subconsciously once they wear the merch or use it in public. You can sell branded hoodies, shirts, hats and more. 

Despite this feature being a great branding tool, you must be a part of the YouTube partner program to use it. The YouTube partner program requires you to have at least 10,000 subscribers and 4000 hours of watch time.

If you satisfy YouTube’s requirements, you can have the merch shelf and place your products on various sections of your YouTube profile and videos. If you have products in your merch shelf, the store tab on your YouTube’s channel homepage will be activated allowing you to showcase your products there. 

You can also showcase your products when you go live by pinning the products at the top of your live control room. You can also display the products within your end screens. End screens is a YouTube feature that allows you to include content you would love your audience to view next after the current video they are watching ends. You can have your products show up at the end screens of specific videos. 

8. Creatively Script a Branded Series 

Currently, people love watching Netflix during their free time. They mostly love watching series collections of various genres. Therefore, you can take advantage of this habit and create a branded series that suits the type of content you create on OnlyFans. 

When creating a series, do not post the complete episodes on YouTube; rather, post a part of the series and direct your subscribers to your OnlyFans page to view the complete series. This move leaves your subscribers with no choice but to pay to view the complete series especially when it is interesting. 

If you are an NSFW content creator, you can use this trick to create less sexually revealing content for the series you post on YouTube and then create an NSFW series complementing the YouTube series and post on your OnlyFans page. This move satisfies the rules of both platforms without compromising either of your accounts. 

70% of YouTube’s views are determined by their artificial intelligence algorithm that recommends content to creators based on various factors. Therefore, creating a series makes it easier for the algorithm to recommend your content, increasing your watch time and increasing the chances of your subscribers considering watching the complete series on your OnlyFans page.

9. Take Time to Engage with Your Audience 

How will your subscribers know that you have an OnlyFans page if you do not communicate that you have one? You must keep them engaged and remind them to click on the link within your profile or video description section. 

When engaging with your audience, either when you are live or commenting, avoid mentioning the word OnlyFans. Doing so might lead to your account being flagged due to YouTube’s community rules. 

Take time to respond to your audience’s comments to know them better. Learn from comments containing constructive criticism to help you improve the quality of content you post and serve your audience better. 

Avoid responding to comments of trolls or subscribers who ask you so much about your OnlyFans account. Trolls can get your account banned because they keep nagging you to talk about your OnlyFans business on YouTube so that they can report you; hence, sabotaging your business. Keep off comments directly inquiring about the content you post on OnlyFans and just reply with your link. Do not discuss anything further. 

Conclusion

YouTube presents you with a one-time opportunity to get more OnlyFans subscribers by promoting your OnlyFans content on the platform. You have access to more than 2.5 billion YouTube users and the numbers keep growing. Therefore, to get the attention of your target audience, let your YouTube profile do the promoting, search engines optimize your content, or execute the other effective tactics outlined in this article. You do not have to try them out one by one, experiment with two or three or even four at a go. 

If you find it overwhelming to promote your OnlyFans content on YouTube, do not give up your chance to have a huge subscriber count; reach out to Fandafia for help. They have a team of experienced experts ready to help you promote your OnlyFans business on YouTube. Book your appointment today.
